Facilities include lots of seating, public toilets (incl disabled and baby change facilities, free WiFi, free to use public computers, tea / coffee available, phone / device charging, newspapers, water cooler, digital help. Lift access to 1st floor library.

properties.description: Welcoming spaces are run by local people from the voluntary, community and faith sector across West Northamptonshire. Their aim is to tackle social isolation and cost of living challenges. They offer a warm, trusted setting for people to socialise and access services.
properties.title: Brackley - Grand Union Housing Group

properties.address: Brackley Library, Manor Road, Brackley, NN13 6AJ
properties.description: Welcoming spaces are run by local people from the voluntary, community and faith sector across West Northamptonshire. Their aim is to tackle social isolation and cost of living challenges. They offer a warm, trusted setting for people to socialise and access services.
properties.title: Brackley Library

properties.description: What we provide is friendly welcome, it’s somewhere to come along and make new friends of all ages, we chat around a table and conversation is such an important part of our group, speaking about what worries and finding safe practical solutions. The meeting room is has good disability provision including parking and chairs for different needs. I provide projects for the group these can be knitted, crocheted, sewn all crafts and we have had many sessions for learners and have members with no interest in those projects instead they are interested in our community. The community of the group is what I’m most proud and passion about it supports and builds friendships, foster relationships works in the wider communities and truly is a welcoming space.
properties.title: Brackley Library Knit and Natter

properties.description: Welcoming spaces are run by local people from the voluntary, community and faith sector across West Northamptonshire. Their aim is to tackle social isolation and cost of living challenges. They offer a warm, trusted setting for people to socialise and access services.
properties.title: Newbottle and Charlton Memorial Hall

properties.description: The Saints Community Project runs every Wednesday at the Brackley Football Club from 10am and is open to everyone of any age. It started as a regular coffee morning and has grown into so much more – the provision of a lunch if required, themed celebration days and outings.  The scheme also brings in specialist speakers who can advise on all manner of things in the everyday world which have become so technical that they may be somewhat bewildering; to this end, charitable funding to the Wednesday group has enabled the purchase of a laptop so that the helpers can always assist those attending with online access.
properties.title: Saints Brackley Community Trust

properties.address: Southfield Cp School, Banbury Road, , Brackley, Northamptonshire, NN13 6AU
